context_evidences: - Blockchain and cryptocurrency website Coindesk reported over the weekend that Coinbase stakeholders and investors sold about $5 billion in shares in total during first day of trading. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/technology/coinbase-chief-executive-armstrong-sold-2918-million-shares-opening-day-2021-04-19/ published on 2021-04-19 00:29:24

- Coinbase Global Inc COIN CEO Brian Armstrong plans to sell 2% of his Coinbase holdings over the next year. According to the company statement, Armstrong owns 16% of Coinbase and controls 59.5% of its voting shares. Reference: https://www.benzinga.com/markets/cryptocurrency/22/10/29278664/heres-why-coinbase-ceo-brian-armstrong-wants-to-sell-2-of-his-company-stake published on 2022-10-15 14:17:10

- Crypto exchange Coinbase Global Inc (COIN.O) cut over 60 jobs in its recruiting and institutional onboarding teams, a spokesperson said on Thursday, at a time when pummeled digital coins risk another contagion in the sector and bigger rival FTX inches closer to a collapse. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/technology/coinbase-cuts-jobs-again-cryptocurrencies-extend-fall-2022-11-10/ published on 2022-11-10 20:05:04

- The companies where Armstrong was aiming to invest are ResearchHub and NewLimit. ResearchHub is “a tool for the open publication and discussion of scientific research." Researchhub’s users are rewarded with ResearchCoin (RSC) for publishing, reviewing, criticizing and collaborating in the open. Reference: https://www.benzinga.com/markets/cryptocurrency/22/10/29278664/heres-why-coinbase-ceo-brian-armstrong-wants-to-sell-2-of-his-company-stake published on 2022-10-15 14:17:10

- In a Tuesday morning blog post , Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong announced the decision and warned of a recession and a looming crypto winter. Reference: https://fortune.com/2022/06/14/coinbase-layoffs-recession-crypto-winter-ceo-brian-armstrong/ published on 2022-06-14 12:57:23

- Coinbase Global Inc went public in a high-profile debut on the Nasdaq that briefly valued it at more than $100 billion. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/technology/coinbase-chief-executive-armstrong-sold-2918-million-shares-opening-day-2021-04-19/ published on 2021-04-19 00:29:24

- “We appear to be entering a recession after a 10+ year economic boom. A recession could lead to another crypto winter, and could last for an extended period,” Armstrong wrote. “In past crypto winters, trading revenue (our largest revenue source) has declined significantly. While it’s hard to predict the economy or the markets, we always plan for the worst so we can operate the business through any environment.” Reference: https://fortune.com/2022/06/14/coinbase-layoffs-recession-crypto-winter-ceo-brian-armstrong/ published on 2022-06-14 12:57:23

- The job cuts, the second time this year, follow a week after "crypto market headwinds" contributed to Coinbase's net loss of $544.6 million for the three months ended Sept. 30, compared to a profit of $406.1 million a year ago. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/technology/coinbase-cuts-jobs-again-cryptocurrencies-extend-fall-2022-11-10/ published on 2022-11-10 20:05:04
correction_response:
This tweet is somewhat misleading. While it's true that Brian Armstrong, CEO of Coinbase, has sold shares, it's not necessarily indicative of a lack of confidence in the company. Armstrong has previously stated that he remains bullish on crypto and Coinbase, and is fully dedicated to growing its business. He also plans to sell only 2% of his Coinbase holdings over the next year, while still controlling 59.5% of its voting shares. Furthermore, Armstrong has expressed his expectation for the company’s NFT business to be on par with, or even bigger than its cryptocurrency business. Therefore, his selling of shares could be part of a broader strategy rather than a sign of impending doom. 

https://www.benzinga.com/markets/cryptocurrency/22/10/29278664/heres-why-coinbase-ceo-brian-armstrong-wants-to-sell-2-of-his-company-stake
https://www.reuters.com/technology/coinbase-chief-executive-armstrong-sold-2918-million-shares-opening-day-2021-04-19/
note_1_text: Brian Armstrong tweeted in October 2022 that he would sell shares this year to fund scientific research. It is not unusual for executives or founding members of a public company to cash out shares, and does not always signal "loss of confidence" as expressed in the tweet.    https://twitter.com/brian_armstrong/status/1581099147855155200?s=20&t=8FHahFNH5fwYZ1TfvlgNZg    https://blockworks.co/news/coinbase-ceo-to-sell-2-of-his-coin-to-fund-scientific-research
note_2_text: It is not uncommon for executives to sell shares for reinvesting in new ventures [1] A few company execs sold shares before massive drops in stock value. [2][3] Review the companies portfolio & fwd looking statement to assess their financial health.[4]    [1] https://www.cnbc.com/2022/11/08/elon-musk-sells-at-least-3point95-billion-worth-of-tesla-shares.html    [2]https://tokenist.com/robinhood-ceo-sells-45-million-in-shares-amid-companys-questionable-valuation/    [3] https://nypost.com/2022/03/03/pelotons-ex-ceo-john-foley-sells-50m-in-stock/    [4]https://www.nasdaq.com/market-activity/stocks/coin

refute_evidences: - Armstrong had said he expects the company’s NFT business to be on par with, or even bigger than its cryptocurrency business . Reference: https://www.benzinga.com/markets/cryptocurrency/22/10/29278664/heres-why-coinbase-ceo-brian-armstrong-wants-to-sell-2-of-his-company-stake published on 2022-10-15 14:17:10

- Coinbase (COIN.O) Chief Executive Brian Armstrong sold about $292 million in shares in total during the cryptocurrency exchange's first day of trading on the Nasdaq in the past week, according to regulatory filings. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/technology/coinbase-chief-executive-armstrong-sold-2918-million-shares-opening-day-2021-04-19/ published on 2021-04-19 00:29:24

- Armstrong sold 749,999 shares in three batches at prices ranging from $381 to $410.40 per share for total proceeds of $291.8 million, the filings made with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission showed. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/technology/coinbase-chief-executive-armstrong-sold-2918-million-shares-opening-day-2021-04-19/ published on 2021-04-19 00:29:24

- Talking about the current cryptocurrency market and the uphill battle it is facing, Armstrong said he remained super bullish on crypto and Coinbase and was fully dedicated to growing its business. Reference: https://www.benzinga.com/markets/cryptocurrency/22/10/29278664/heres-why-coinbase-ceo-brian-armstrong-wants-to-sell-2-of-his-company-stake published on 2022-10-15 14:17:10
tweet_image2text: An article claiming, "Brian Armstrong Sells Over $1.6 Million in Coinbase Shares." It was written by Jordan Lyanchev and last updated on Nov 16, 2022 @ 15:50. The article discusses the sale of assets taking place shortly after another wave of layoffs at Coinbase and the ongoing FTX drama.
tweet_text: Take what you can out of the sinking ship. In the real world, that is, pre-crypto, a CEO never sell his or her own shares while shouting "all is OK". A CEO selling shares expresses such a loss of confidence in the company it is taken extremely seriously. https://t.co/tzqnIwjd8q
